item.title: 卡尼表示对修改绿色法律以促进能源项目持开放态度
item.description: 加拿大总理马克-卡尼（Mark Carney）表示，他将考虑修改其前任贾斯汀-特鲁多（Justin Trudeau）通过的环境法规，以促进包括石油和天然气管道在内的加拿大重大项目的投资。【原文：Prime Minister Mark Carney said he’ll consider altering environmental regulations passed by his predecessor, Justin Trudeau, in order to facilitate investment in major projects in Canada, including oil and gas pipelines.】

item.title: 参议院共和党人对众议院取消能源减税的计划表示反对
item.description: 参议院的主要共和党人正在抵制众议院削减清洁能源税收抵免的计划，誓言减轻对新兴技术的打击。【原文：Key Senate Republicans are resisting the House’s plan to gut clean energy tax credits, vowing to soften the blow for emerging technologies.】

item.title: 美国共和党削减美国气候开支计划的最大输家
item.description:
该提案将取消广受欢迎的电动汽车和家用太阳能税收抵免。【原文：

The proposal would eliminate popular tax credits for electric vehicles and home solar. 

】

item.title: 中国企业将向埃塞俄比亚矿业和太阳能产业投资 17.5 亿美元
item.description: 埃塞俄比亚财政部长艾哈迈德-希德（Ahmed Shide）表示，埃塞俄比亚预计将有五家中国公司在这个东非国家投资总计 17.5 亿美元，主要用于太阳能电池制造和矿产勘探。【原文：Ethiopia expects five Chinese companies to invest a total of $1.75 billion in the East African nation, mainly in solar-cell manufacturing and mineral exploration, according to Finance Minister Ahmed Shide.】

item.title: 美国众议院提案好于预期，太阳能股价飙升
item.description: 在众议院共和党人公布了一份税收法案草案之后，美国太阳能公司股价大涨，该草案对该行业的许多参与者比分析师预期的要宽松。议员们还提议取消氢气生产税收抵免，导致 Plug Power 公司股价下跌。【原文：Shares in US solar companies jumped after House Republicans released a draft of a tax bill that went easier on many players in the sector than analysts had expected. The lawmakers also proposed eliminating a production tax credit for hydrogen, sending Plug Power Inc. stock lower.】

item.title: 随着海岸线的侵蚀，加州一城市考虑 "立即撤退
item.description:
卡尔斯巴德与许多其他海滨社区不同，它可能拥有足够的时间、空间和资源来应对海岸侵蚀。【原文：

Carlsbad, unlike many other seaside communities, might just have the time, space and resources to get ahead of coastal erosion. 

】

item.title: 受关税影响最严重的汽车可能不是你想象的那种
item.description:
汽车制造商更有可能对最受欢迎的轿车和卡车提价，而不一定是对最受欢迎的外国车型提价。

汽车制造商更有可能对最受欢迎的轿车和卡车提价，而不一定是对最受欢迎的外国车型提价。【原文：

Carmakers are more likely to hike prices for the most coveted cars and trucks, not necessarily the most foreign.

】

item.title: 泰晤士河水务公司称今夏可能限水
item.description: 泰晤士水务有限公司（Thames Water Utilities Ltd. —）告诉立法者，不排除今年夏天需要要求用户限制用水量。【原文：Thames Water Utilities Ltd. — which serves about a quarter of the UK including London — told lawmakers it can’t rule out needing to ask customers to restrict water usage this summer.】

item.title: 台湾为重启原子能发电厂打开逆转之门
item.description: 台湾立法者周二修订了一项核电法案，实际上为重启岛上的原子工厂打开了大门，此举凸显了随着台湾能源需求的增长和地缘政治紧张局势的恶化，其政策正在发生更广泛的转变。【原文：Taiwanese lawmakers revised a nuclear power bill on Tuesday that effectively opens the door for a restart of the island’s atomic plants, a move that underscores a wider policy shift as its energy demand grows and geopolitical tensions worsen.】

item.title: 中国太阳能股票因减产计划报道而大涨
item.description: 当地媒体报道称，一家大型企业正在与同行商谈全行业减产事宜，以支撑因供应过剩而跌至谷底的价格，此后中国太阳能股票周二跳涨。【原文：Chinese solar stocks jumped on Tuesday after local media reported a major firm was in talks with peers about an industry-wide output cut in a bid to support prices that have hit rock bottom due to oversupply.】

item.title: 剑桥大学研究称，投资者面临 ESG 冲击，因为风险被错误定价
item.description: 剑桥大学学者的一项研究表明，投资者缺乏追逐可持续目标的经济动力，一旦情绪发生变化，他们将更容易遭受损失。【原文：Investors lack financial incentives to chase sustainable targets, leaving them more exposed to losses once sentiment shifts, according to a study by academics at the University of Cambridge.】

item.title: 美国共和党将逐步取消拜登清洁能源信贷，为减税买单
item.description: 众议院共和党人提议取消对电动汽车的税收减免，并逐步取消对清洁能源生产的激励措施，以帮助支付唐纳德-特朗普总统的大规模税收方案。【原文：House Republicans are proposing to eliminate a tax credit for electric vehicles and phase out incentives for the production of clean energy to help pay for President Donald Trump’s massive tax package.】

item.title: 阿尔伯塔省冻结工业碳税以帮助企业应对关税对经济的冲击
item.description: 阿尔伯塔省正在冻结其工业碳税，以帮助在美国关税影响下苦苦挣扎的企业，这可能会给首相马克-卡尼（Mark Carney）的政府带来挑战。【原文：Alberta is freezing its industrial carbon tax in a bid to help companies struggling with the effects of US tariffs, potentially setting up a challenge to the government of Prime Minister Mark Carney.】

item.title: 特朗普削减开支迫使清洁技术公司考虑退出美国市场
item.description: 前总统乔-拜登（Joe Biden）领导下有资格获得支持的清洁技术公司现在正考虑离开美国，因为负责审查这些公司的项目的前负责人说，特朗普政府已经停止了对这些公司的融资。【原文：Clean-tech companies that were eligible for support under former President Joe Biden are now considering leaving the US as the Trump administration pulls the plug on financing, according to the former head of the program that vetted the firms.】

item.title: 紧张局势加剧，格陵兰人掌舵北极理事会
item.description:
这个在世界最高级别促进合作和气候科学的机构正面临地缘政治压力。【原文：

The body that fosters collaboration and climate science at the top of the world is under geopolitical pressure.

】

item.title: Equinor 已停止的纽约风电项目时间紧迫
item.description: Equinor ASA 在纽约海岸的帝国风力发电厂已经停工，挪威石油天然气公司每周因此损失 5000 万美元。【原文：Time is running out for Equinor ASA’s halted Empire Wind farm off the coast of New York which is costing the Norwegian oil and gas company $50 million a week.】

item.title: 德国太阳能发电量再创新高
item.description: 德国数以千计的太阳能电池板在本周一创下了新的生产纪录。【原文：Germany’s many thousands of solar panels set a new production record on Monday.】

item.title: 报告称西班牙南部停电先于全国停电
item.description: 两周前，西班牙南部发生了全国性大停电，数百万人陷入黑暗之中。【原文：Power failures in southern Spain preceded a nationwide blackout that left millions in the dark two weeks ago, according to the most detailed report yet on the events leading up to the debacle.】

item.title: NHK 称日产大规模裁员达 2 万人
item.description: 据日本国家广播公司周一报道，日产汽车公司将裁员1.1万人，超过此前的计划，这是该公司重组其濒临破产的业务计划的一部分。【原文：Nissan Motor Co. will eliminate 11,000 more jobs than it previously planned, Japan’s national broadcaster reported Monday, as part of a plan to restructure its flailing business.】

item.title: 澳大利亚最大的液化天然气工厂必须赢得新部长的青睐
item.description: 澳大利亚新任环境部长面临着一个紧迫的最后期限，他必须熟悉一项有争议且拖延已久的申请，即把该国历史最悠久、规模最大的液化天然气出口工厂再运营四十年。【原文：Australia’s new environment minister faces a tight deadline to familiarize himself with a controversial and long-delayed application to run the nation’s oldest and biggest liquefied natural gas export plant for another four decades.】

item.title: 伦敦政治经济学院集团研究发现气候适应产业价值 1 万亿美元
item.description: 伦敦证券交易所集团公司（London Stock Exchange Group Plc）的一项研究表明，应对气候变化带来的实际风险的公司正在获得可衡量的经济效益。【原文：Companies responding to the physical risks associated with climate change are seeing a measurable financial benefit, according to a study by London Stock Exchange Group Plc.】

item.title: 消费者抱怨电动汽车营销，小米股价下跌
item.description: 当地媒体上周末报道称，有300多人希望取消SU7 Ultra电动汽车的订单，原因是该汽车的引擎盖设计存在 "虚假宣传"，小米公司股价周一在香港下跌了5.7%。【原文：Xiaomi Corp. shares dropped as much as 5.7% in Hong Kong on Monday after a local media report over the weekend that said more than 300 people want to cancel their SU7 Ultra electric vehicle orders on “false advertising” about the design of the vehicle’s hood.】

item.title: 塔布鲁克为耗资 5 亿欧元的阿尔卑斯生物炼油厂寻找买家
item.description: 总部位于纽约、资产达 190 亿美元的私募股权投资集团 Towerbrook Capital Partners 正在为奥地利阿尔卑斯山的一家生物精炼厂寻找潜在竞标者，该厂有望采用新型气候技术。【原文：Towerbrook Capital Partners, a New York-based private equity group with $19 billion in assets, is courting potential bidders for a bio-refinery in the Austrian Alps with the promise of a novel climate technology.】

item.title: 海鲜餐厅菜单为何需要改变
item.description:
新英格兰的一位环保人士正在努力为因气候变化而迁入当地水域的新鱼种和蟹种创建一个 "气候赢家 "消费市场。【原文：

A New England environmentalist is working to create a “climate winners” consumer market for new fish and crab species migrating into local waters due to climate change.

】

item.title: 特朗普团队考虑加快核电站建设
item.description: 特朗普政府官员正在制定行政命令，以加快全美核电站的审批和建设，从而满足激增的电力需求。【原文：Trump administration officials are crafting executive orders to expedite the approval and construction of nuclear power plants across the US, a bid to meet surging electricity demand.】

item.title: 美国最大电网警告：极端高温将带来夏季电力短缺风险
item.description: 从中西部到东海岸为约 20% 的美国人提供服务的美国最大电网 PJM Interconnection LLC 警告说，今年夏天的极端高温可能会首次引发供应短缺。【原文：PJM Interconnection LLC, the largest US electric grid serving about 20% of Americans from the Midwest to East Coast, warned that extreme heat this summer could trigger supply shortages for the first time.】

item.title: 津巴布韦首次推出区块链碳信用交易登记处
item.description: 津巴布韦首次推出了一个区块链注册机构，允许已获批准的项目开发商交易该国的碳信用额度。【原文：Zimbabwe has debuted a blockchain-enabled registry that will allow approved project developers to trade the nation’s carbon credits.】

item.title: 为什么特朗普停止统计天气损失的计划对保险业很重要？
item.description:
美国国家海洋和大气管理局（NOAA）的十亿美元灾害清单为跟踪与气候变化和发展相关的不断增加的损失提供了一个重要的衡量标准。【原文：

NOAA’s billion-dollar disaster list provides a crucial metric for tracking rising damages tied to climate change and development.

】

item.title: CATL 寻求至少 40 亿美元在香港上市
item.description: 当代安培瑞斯科技有限公司（Amperex Technology Co.据熟悉内情的人士透露，安培瑞斯科技有限公司正计划从香港股票发行中募集至少 40 亿美元的资金，这将使该公司成为今年全球最大的上市企业。【原文：Contemporary Amperex Technology Co. Ltd. is planning to seek at least $4 billion from its Hong Kong stock offering, people familiar with the matter said, which would make it the world’s biggest listing this year.】

item.title: 美国国际开发署的衰落威胁着非洲重要的健康和气候解决方案
item.description:
停止供资损害了逐步淘汰污染型家用炉灶并代之以更清洁替代品的努力。【原文：

A funding stoppage hurts efforts to phase out polluting home cookstoves and replace them with cleaner alternatives. 

】
